[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: get_position_value()] [Access Control] Since this is a public function, can external contracts call it with manipulated pool/position references to extract sensitive pricing information or cause computational DoS? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: update_momentum_position_value()] [Authorization] Is there validation that the asset_type string corresponds to an actual Momentum position in the vault, or can attackers pass arbitrary strings to create ghost assets? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: get_position_value()] [Oracle Staleness] Does the function verify oracle price freshness before using price_a and price_b in calculations, or can stale prices from hours/days ago pass validation and corrupt position values? [File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: get_position_value()] [Oracle Manipulation] If price_b is manipulated to be very small (near zero), can the division price_a * DECIMAL / price_b cause overflow in relative_price_from_oracle calculation at line 51? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: get_position_value()] [Oracle DoS] Can an attacker cause vault_oracle::get_asset_price to revert by providing type_name_a or type_name_b not configured in OracleConfig, causing DoS of all position value updates? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: get_position_value()] [Oracle Bypass] Can an attacker set dex_slippage() to 10000 (100%) in config to bypass the price sanity check entirely, allowing arbitrary pool manipulation to pass validation? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: get_position_value()] [Price Manipulation] Can flash loan attacks manipulate pool.sqrt_price() temporarily to pass the slippage check window, then revert after value update is committed? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: get_position_value()] [Oracle Precision] When calculating relative_price_from_oracle with price_a * DECIMAL / price_b, can precision loss for low-value tokens cause the slippage check to incorrectly pass/fail? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: get_position_value()] [Oracle Attack] Can an attacker exploit the diff() calculation by manipulating pool_price to be exactly equal to relative_price_from_oracle * (1 + slippage threshold - epsilon), passing validation with maximum deviation? [File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: get_position_value()] [Double Oracle Call] Are normalized_price_a and normalized_price_b guaranteed to be from the same oracle update as price_a and price_b, or can oracle updates between calls cause price inconsistency? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: get_position_value()] [Slippage Bypass] Can the slippage check be bypassed if relative_price_from_oracle is zero, causing division by zero or assertion bypass in the comparison logic? (Critical)
